status_message:
"At night, I found myself waking up every hour or so gasping for air", Farhan Noor recalls of his time in NUS when he was hit with numerous health problems.

He had to give up his studies years later when a neurosurgeon told him the root of his problems was due to his severely damaged spine from a previous biking accident and that he had to have emergency surgery right away.

Today, he is the creator of a mobile gifting app 'Fuzzie' which has attracted the attention of multiple venture capitalists and corporations. http://str.sg/ZBm8

More on our live blog ST Now: http://str.sg/ZXb4

#GE2015: "We certainly don't take this strong support for granted... that would be disastrous" said Social and Family Development Minister Tan Chuan-Jin, when asked how the PAP would ensure it won't be lulled into complacency.

status_message:
#GE2015: "We were a bit perplexed", says Marine Parade GRC anchor minister Tan Chuan-Jin. Mr Tan said that the online sentiments and bookies' odds prior to the polls did not appear to tally with the feedback he got on the ground, which eventually led to a massive swing in votes towards the People's Action Party. More on our live blog, ST Now: http://str.sg/ZXb4

Plus, recap all the drama, sights and sounds of GE2015 in our e-book Singapore's Jubilee Election: http://str.sg/ZXbs

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, speaking to reporters at the end of his Thank You parade in Ang Mo Kio GRC, said his first order of business will be to form a new Cabinet within the next two weeks. http://str.sg/ZX2F

He also shared that the next Transport Minister has a very "difficult" and "demanding" job, but he will find somebody suitable. More on our live blog: http://str.sg/ZXex
The day after Polling Day, Workers' Party chairman Sylvia Lim discusses the party's performance. More videos in our live blog http://str.sg/ZXnJ

#GE2015: WP's East Coast and Fengshan candidates saying thank you to voters in Bedok North Street 1. str.sg/ZXXj

The WP lost to PAP in both constituencies, with a vote share of 39.3% in East Coast GRC and 42.5% in Fengshan SMC.

At East Coast GRC: The PAP team, led by Manpower Minister Lim Swee Say, thanking residents at a Bedok South Road market early Saturday morning. str.sg/ZXXj

The team won 60.7 per cent of the vote against a WP team led by Mr Gerald Giam.

#GE2015 "What counts is not numbers, what counts is the quality of opposition candidates, and the quality of the PAP candidates," says Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong. Recap the night's rallies on our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.
#GE2015 Workers' Party chairman Sylvia Lim on the topic of happiness. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 "I, in the next 5 years, do hope and pray we've 10 more Roys, 100 more Roys, 1000 more Roys so that we can take back our Singapore that's right now in oppression," says Reform Party member Gilbert Goh, referring to team mate blogger Roy Ngerng.

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.
#GE2015 Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on the Workers' Party. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on opposition tactics: "If it's good, ask for more. If it's bad, it's PAP's fault." Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.
#GE2015 DPM Tharman Shanmugaratnam on the possible polarisation of the labour force. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 "Examine what each party has promised you. Think about the characters of the people who are offering themselves to represent you, not just what they say, but what sort of people they are," says Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong. "This election is about our future."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Singapore Democratic Party chief Chee Soon Juan clarifying the party's policies on housing, CPF and hiring processes. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 "We don't believe in punishing the top earners, we are more concerned with the bottom 20 per cent," says Reform Party chief Kenneth Jeyaretnam. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.
#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate He Ting Ru on "The Next Lap". Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Arthero Lim, the Singing Politician, says his voice is hoarse from singing songs. "It's a good thing it has received many views." Of the problems his party has highlighted, he says: "I've taken all this emotionally. As a writer, I write from feelings, I don't copy stories."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.
#GE2015 PAP candidate for Potong Pasir Mr Sitoh Yih Pin says there is still much to do in the area. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 "We have a combined service of 60 years serving residents," says PAP candidate Lily Neo of the Jalan Besar team. "My rapport with residents was built over many years… this cannot be earned overnight, just during the short period before each GE."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.
#GE2015 Reform Party candidate Jesse Loo on the calibre of his party members. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 SingFirst party member Wong Soon Hong says the party is not racist or xenophobic. "Singapore belongs to all Singapore citizens," he adds.

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for coverage.

#GE2015 SDP's Holland-Bukit Timah GRC candidate Sidek Mallek talks about his journey to becoming an election candidate. He quotes ex-US First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You must do the thing which you think you cannot do."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for coverage.

#GE2015 Workers' Party MacPherson candidate Bernard Chen says the GRC system dilutes the voice of individual voters. "If Ms Tin Pei Ling can run in a single seat, I'm sure all our present and future ministers can hold their own and contest in a single seat." 

WP also wants to lower the voting age from 21 to 18 to empower the youth. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for coverage.

Pony-tailed rocker-lawyer Josephus Tan, who was emcee for the PAP rally at Yishun Stadium, led the crowd in doing the "Nee Soon wave".

Press conference by PAP Marine Parade team: On the next government, ESM Goh Chok Tong says every minister has his or her strengths and weaknesses and that a very strong team is needed. "Only Lee Kuan Yew was all strength and no weakness," he says. http://str.sg/ZXpq

More on our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom)

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for more.

Kiss92 FM's Arnold Gay, The Straits Times' managing editor Ignatius Low, assistant political desk editor Rachel Chang and team leader Francis Chan round up Tuesday's rally action.

#GE2015 PAP candidate K Shanmugam gives wide-ranging speech on the internal and external challenges Singapore faces, speaks out against opposition policies such as slashing of the defence budget. He also touches on the "DNA" of the PAP. "(Singaporeans) helped create the system, which emphasises practicality, long-term planning and honesty."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 "Fight for us! Take back our CPF!" say supporters of independent candidate Han Hui Hui after her rally. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 PAP candidate Lim Biow Chuan says Mountbatten voters should ask rival, SPP's Jeannette Chong-Aruldoss, why she has "switched her loyalties so quickly." Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 SPP's Lina Chiam recites lyrics from a pop song, which was sent to her by a supporter. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 Veteran opposition politician Chiam See Tong takes the stage to loud applause. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 NSP's Kevryn Lim on the "trial and error" of voting an opposition party into Parliament. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 "We may have lost, but we never gave up. We were pursuing the dream for Singapore and Singaporeans," says SPP's Lina Chiam. 

"If you vote me in, you'll get the best 2-in-1 coffee mix! I shall be your full-time MP, together with an ex-MP of 27 years to take care of you. You've got 2 MPs!" she says, in reference to her husband, veteran opposition leader Chiam See Tong.

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 "I will speak up about issues that I care about - animal welfare, volunteerism and parenthood. I will also speak up for issues residents of Nee Soon care about," says PAP candidate Louis Ng. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 "Housewives don't have CPF," says independent candidate Han Hui Hui as she speaks on the issues she says she sees in the area. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 Dr Ng Eng Hen speaks in Mandarin about PAP's achievements in education, housing and developing Singapore. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 PAP candidate Henry Kwek, 37, takes the stage. The executive director of food supply company Foodtraco is contesting in Nee Soon GRC. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 Independent candidate Han Hui Hui starts late due to a contractor dispute, says she is honoured to be third most talked about on Twitter. She adds that she has no need for garlands, as she "isn't a flower vase." 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 Singapore sprinter Dipna Lim Prasad on how PAP candidate Lee Bee Wah helped her with her university application, calls her "a real fighter."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate Leon Perera on the train breakdown this morning, and the party manifesto. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 National Solidarity Party candidate Yip Yew Weng says the ruling party is only doing what they are paid to do. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 ""The response was very friendly. Whether that translates into votes, has yet to be seen. We certainly don't take that for granted. We have to work hard for every vote," says DPM Tharman Shanmugaratnam at Kovan. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 PAP member Josephus Tan works up the crowd before the speakers come on stage. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 Former MP Hri Kumar Nair, who is not contesting this election, talks about how well-run the Bishan-Toa Payoh town council is. It received the "green" grade from the Ministry of National Development for the past five years. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate Dylan Ng kicks off rally with speech in Mandarin. He reiterates WP's stance on foreign labour, that the government should encourage stay-at-home mothers and senior citizens to work rather than relying on imported labour. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 PAP candidate Lee Bee Wah interacts with members of the audience before the rally. See our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.
#GE2015 The Workers' Party rally at Serangoon stadium is about to start soon. It is one of 11 rallies tonight. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015 DPM Tharman Shanmugaratnam arrives at Kovan food market, accompanied by PAP candidates for Aljunied GRC. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter account (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more.

#GE2015: Kiss92 FM's Arnold Gay, and The Straits Times' political desk's Francis Chan and deputy political editor Zakir Hussain pick their highlights from Monday's rallies, including the "tussle" over Deputy Prime Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam and National Solidarity Party's Kevryn Lim's tears. http://str.sg/ZXJE

#GE2015 "We are a successful country. We have good reason to stand tall and be proud. We are going to look after every single person who needs help," says PAP candidate Vivian Balakhrishnan at the end of the rally. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 "We have developed a culture of selfishness," says NSP's Choong Hon Heng who hit out at the ruling party. "Boo to PAP," he shouts at the end of his speech.

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 PAP candidate Vivian Balakhrishnan on healthcare in Singapore. "Don't get scared by politicians telling that healthcare will bankrupt you in Singapore." 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 Is the PAP a cruise ship or the Titanic? Who are the top three most talked about politicians? Which election stories are most shared? Here are the top social media trends (Sept 7): str.sg/ZXZw
#GE2015 National Solidarity Party's Kevryn Lim on breaking down on stage at the party rally. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates
#GE2015 Workers' Party chief Low Thia Khiang on checks and balances within the PAP. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 Singapore Democratic Party chief Chee Soon Juan takes the stage last to loud cheers from the crowd. His speech is a letter dedicated to the late J.B. Jeyaretnam. 

"They may take away all our possessions but they will never take away our will to speak up. You have inspired an entire generation of Singaporeans and we will keep the fight going," he says. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 PAP candidate Vivian Balakrishnan on what SDP's Paul Tambyah said about secretly wishing that DPM Tharman would have a fallout with PM Lee Hsien Loong and join the opposition. In a swipe at SDP chief Chee Soon Juan, Balakhrishnan said he had just one message for the SDP: "In the PAP, we do not have a tradition of backstabbing our mentors".

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 Singapore Democratic Party's Paul Tambyah says that "Singapore is bigger than the PAP" at the Toh Guan Road rally. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.
#GE2015 National Solidarity Party candidate Kevryn Lim tears up as she speaks about the plight of single mothers. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 PAP candidate Sim Ann says SDP's Chee Soon Juan likes to "chut pattern", meaning someone who is full of antics. In a speech dripping with sarcasm, she tells the crowd: "If Dr Chee says he is second when it comes to 'chut pattern', no one else would dare to claim first." 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 "The PAP may have performed well in the past, but as some investors say, past performance is no guarantee of future performance," says Terence Tan of the Workers' Party. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 PAP candidate Liang Eng Hwa says some opposition candidates could also enter the Singapore Book of Records for the speed in which they conduct their house visits.

He also says: "Clearly from the campaign so far, our opponents have shown that they have no interest in local matters. They are only interested in getting into Parliament for the glamour."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 NSP's Choong Hon Heng on CPF: "We can also return you back the CPF money, and give you the option to opt in."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 Yuhua SMC candidate Jaslyn Go, 43, takes the stage at the SDP rally at Toh Guan Road. She talks about the high cost of living in Singapore, using COE premiums as an example. "Cars are not luxury items."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 SingFirst rally begins with Jurong GRC hopeful Wong Soon Hong. He takes aim at the Population White Paper, saying it was poorly written and that it has reflected badly on the quality of the civil service. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 Pap supporter Red See says he is a big fan of PAP candidate Dr Vivian Balakrishnan. "I'm here to support him. He helped me a lot, and wrote to Manpower ministry when my ex-employer didn't give me my overtime pay." 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate Luke Koh is the first speaker at the rally tonight. He tackles the question of CPF and sets out the WP's policies on it, focusing on an earlier drawdown age. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) or Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for updates.

PAP West Coast GRC candidate S. Iswaran says at press conference: "The question that needs to be put to other side is: What is the sum impact of your proposals on local businesses, especially SMEs, local workers and local taxpayer?" - ST VIDEO: JOANNA SEOW

Follow the press conference at our #GE2015 live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd

PAP candidate for West Coast GRC Foo Mee Har says at press conference: "RP says that most CPF savings get 2.5 per cent interest only. This is not true. 60 per cent of CPF members aged 55 and older enjoy 6 per cent, 80 per cent enjoy 5 per cent." 

She adds that the CPF scheme has been made a lot more flexible and the recent set of announcements have significantly boosted retirement adequacy. - ST VIDEO: JOANNA SEOW

Follow the press conference at our #GE2015 live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd

Lunchtime rally at UOB Plaza: Dr Chee dismisses talk that the "rich people" of Holland-Bukit Timah GRC where he is contesting, will vote for the PAP. "I believe the residents of Watten Estate and Sixth Avenue care for the elderly poor," he says.

More on our live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd or Twitter: twitter.com/STcom

Lunchtime rally at UOB Plaza promenade: "The PAP is feeling a little hotter than we are right now," SDP chief  Chee Soon Juan says as he thanks the crowd for attending the rally in the hot weather. - ST VIDEO: MARISSA LEE

#GE2015: As campaigning for the Sept 11 polls heads into its second week, radio personality Arnold Gay, together with The Straits Times Editor-at-large Han Fook Kwang and Managing Editor Ignatius Low, give their half-time report. http://str.sg/Z8jn

status_message: #GE2015 Singapore Democratic Party candidate Paul Tambyah says he and PAP candidate Vivian Balakrishnan have differing views on honesty. Catch up on our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom
#GE2015 Singapore Democratic Alliance candidate Arthero Lim has put out a 3-minute music video. This, and other things that are trending on social media on Sept 6 here: str.sg/Z8jf

#GE2015 Singapore Democratic Party chief Chee Soon Juan on PAP's Vivian Balakrishnan's comments and the expenditure on the Youth Olympic Games.  Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom
#GE2015 Workers' Party mega truck, reportedly done up by a supporter, spotted at the rally at Simei Road. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom

#GE2015 Jaslyn Go says she doesn't want to question the timing of release of Grace Fu's 5-year plan for Yuhua, but it should be carried out regardless of which party the ward goes to. "I have the blessing of my husband to be a full-time MP when voted in," she adds. 

Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom

#GE2015 "Self-reliance is to give Singaporeans a minimum wage so that we can help ourselves." - Reform Party candidate Roy Ngerng. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom
#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate Sylvia Lim on succession planning within the party. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom
#GE2015 Singapore People's Party candidate Jeannette Chong-Aruldoss on checks and balances. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom

#GE2015 "The Reform Party might raise the defence budget. Because we would like to reduce National Service to a year... and have a professional army," says RP leader Kenneth Jeyaretnam. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom

#GE2015 Leon Perera, Workers' Party candidate for East Coast GRC, criticises the PAP for always "congratulating themselves", and never admitting they have made mistakes. "Even when we have an MRT breakdown, they like to say the system is still one of the best in the world," he says.

Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom

#GE2015 "We need an independent, considered, rational opposition voice," says Singapore People's Party volunteer Choo Zheng Xi, referring to party candidate Jeannette Chong-Aruldoss. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom
#GE2015 Singapore People's Party candidate Ravi Philemon asks voters to "turn off the tap" on immigration policy. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom

#GE2015 "I'm not here to bash the ruling party, but to tell you the constructive work the SDP has done to better the lives of Singaporeans," Chee Siok Chin tells the crowd.  She says the party's policies "are not manifestos crafted for elections - they are well-thought out policies for real Singaporeans."

Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom
#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate Ron Tan on dialects. Follow our live blog here: str.sg/Z7Pd or our Twitter here: www.twitter.com/STcom

Scene from a rally, taken on September 4.

CREDIT: BASIL EDWARD TEO

Sunday walkabouts in the lead-up to the Sept 11 general election.  The PAP's Tanjong Pagar GRC candidates Chan Chun Sing and Joan Pereira were at Tiong Bahru Market. Follow our live blog for #GE2015 updates here: http://str.sg/Z8Vd

ST VIDEO: TOH YONG CHUAN

#GE2015 During his walkabout this morning at Segar Road, Mr Liang Eng Hwa, part of the incumbent four-member PAP team contesting Holland-Bukit Timah GRC, spoke to residents about the bus service in the area. He even suggested to one resident what bus number to take to town. ST VIDEO: YEO SAM JO
#GE2015: Do Singaporeans know the political party logos? http://str.sg/Z8z9

#GE2015 From the Workers' Party mega truck, to the heartfelt handwritten note to the Singapore Democratic Party, to a survey that might make it easier for you to decide on Polling Day, here's what's trending on social media.

#GE2015 Aljunied incumbent Pritam Singh from the Workers' Party spoke about the political roles of supposedly community grassroots organisations such as the Citizens' Consultative Committees. 

Missed the rallies? Catch up on our live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd.

#GE2015 "I may not have all the answers. Our solutions may need improvement. But the most important thing is that we have raised, and will continue to raise these issues," says Workers' Party candidate Lee Li Lian. 

Missed the rallies? Catch up on our live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd.

#GE2015 "The values that I have, are the values all of you have... The story of Singapore is the story of each of your families. Now at this election, who do you trust?" asked PAP's Vivian Balakrishnan. Missed the rallies? Catch up on our live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd.
#GE2015 People's Action Party supporters taking selfies with the candidates after the rally. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage

#GE2015 "Not only do the (opposition) avoid talking about the taxes they would have to raise if their proposals were to be put in practice, they also scare-monger. That is just cheap." - Finance Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam at the PAP rally at Petir Road.

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage
#GE2015 Singapore People's Party Ravi Philemon at the rally at Bukit Batok West. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 "We are doing it in a way that is fair, where the rich pay more, and the poor get more... we are not pushing the burden to the next generation," says Finance Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam at the PAP rally at Petir Road. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 PAP's Holland-Bukit Timah GRC candidate Sim Ann at the rally in Petir Road tackles arguments put forth by the opposition. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 SingFirst party chief Tan Jee Say says Singaporeans now have a "swill standard of living", instead of the Swiss standard of living promised. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Self-confessed "Polytechnic comeback kid" Liang Eng Hwa on social mobility. He says, in Mandarin, that he's a doer, not a talker. "Some people use kou shui (saliva) to get votes. I want to say, I will use han shui (sweat) and do things for you." 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 "By shouting at top of your voice, that cost of living is very high, will not solve the problem. (It) won't come down as a result of people being critical, without coming up with solutions," says PAP's Liang Eng Hwa.

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Singapore People's Party's Law Kim Hwee says PAP's policies worked in the past, but they no longer do. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Have you heard the SingFirst cheer? "That is a cheer that we invented for Singaporeans," say candidates on stage. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Former minister of state Yu-Foo Yee Shoon says she would give PAP's performance "80-plus marks" because there is room for improvement. Foreign officials she met, however, would not hesitate to give Singapore an A+. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Retiring MP Hawazi Daipi speaks in English, then Malay. He urges Singaporeans to vote wisely. "I stand here because they are good," he says, referring to the PAP candidates on stage. "Vote based on the track record of the party and candidates." 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 SingFirst's Tanjong Pagar GRC candidate Melvyn Chiu expands on foreigner influx issue: We are not xenophobic. What we're concerned with are jobs in PMET class, that belong to Singaporeans.

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.

#GE2015 Singapore People's Party supporters were putting up party flags at the rally venue. The field at Bukit Batok West Avenue 2 is in Hong Kah North SMC where SPP's Ravi Philemon is running against PAP's Dr Amy Khor. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) for more coverage.
PM Lee on his walkabout now at Hougang Mall. For live updates and streaming of rallies tonight, check out our live blog. http://str.sg/Z8DR

At Sengkang West SMC: PAP candidate Dr Lam Pin Min making house visits. He has covered about 25 blocks in Sengkang West mid-way into his election campaign. - ST VIDEO: MELODY ZACCHEUS

More on our #GE2015 live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd

The Pioneer Generation Package rolled out by the Government has not entirely solved the needs of the pioneer generation, said Workers' Party chief Low Thia Khiang. http://str.sg/Z8De

The Sept 11 General Election is about Singapore's future, choosing the government and leadership, and setting direction, PM Lee Hsien Loong said on Saturday morning. http://str.sg/Z8Dm

At Holland-Bukit Timah GRC: "Don't grow up so fast you know," SDP's Dr Chee Soon Juan tells a boy as his team distributes campaign newsletters at Ghim Moh market. - ST VIDEO: JOANNA SEOW

At East Coast GRC: Minister for Manpower Lim Swee Say responds to online comments about him saying he was glad he was born in Singapore and not in China or Malaysia. More in our #GE2015 live blog: str.sg/Z7Pd

Workers' Party chief Low Thia Khiang on the AHPETC issue: "Who is smoking Singaporeans in this election? Let the people judge." - ST VIDEO: AUDREY TAN

#GE2015: Hot topics discussed last night include CPF and the role of the opposition. There was little talk of the AHPETC saga.

Kiss92 FM's Arnold Gay, The Straits Times' Managing Editor Ignatius Low and political desk's Francis Chan round up Friday's rally action. http://str.sg/Z8RL

#GE2015 Taxi services to provide free transport for those over 80 years old for essential medical appointments. Singapore Democratic Party's Chee Soon Juan explains some of the party's alternative policies. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.
#GE2015 The 'masterplan of MRT' needs to be reviewed, says National Solidarity Party's Kevryn Lim. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Reform Party candidate Roy Ngerng asks rally crowd if the People's Action Party has been responsible towards Singaporeans. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.
#GE2015 Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on what is being done for Aljunied residents. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 "You are voting for the team which will look after the town council. You are also voting for the team which will look after the government," says Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong at the Aljunied rally. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong addresses the crowd at the Aljunied rally. "But unfortunately for the last four years, things haven't gone well at all. And that's why we are sending a good team here, to contest in Aljunied, to convince and persuade you, that PAP is the right choice."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 "Did we bring home more money for ourselves when the foreigners came in?" asks National Solidarity Party's Kevryn Lim. "So why you still vote for (the PAP)? I don't understand."

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Opposition veteran Chiam See Tong arrives and is being helped up on stage at the Singapore People's Party rally at Toa Payoh. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.
#GE2015 Murali Pillai, the PAP candidate for Aljunied GRC, addresses the crowd in Mandarin. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 "This election is about reclaiming control of our own land," says Reform Party candidate M Ravi in his rally speech. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.
#GE2015 Singapore Democratic Party's Jaslyn Go, a candidate for Yuhua SMC, on the importance of minimum wage. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Reform Party's Gilbert Goh asks the crowd to give outgoing Transport Minister Lui Tuck Yew a hand for stepping down. "Because the transport issue is linked to the population white paper. We've brought in too many foreigners," he says. 

Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate Luke Koh: "The driver is not on the right path. We need to keep pushing them in the right direction," he says at the Yishun Stadium rally. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Lim Boon Heng says the waiting time for buses in the past used to be about half an hour. "So MRT two minutes don't complain," says the former Cabinet Minister who leads a PAP task force to win Aljunied GRC back. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.
#GE2015 Lim Boon Heng, who leads a PAP task force to win Aljunied GRC back, on jobs. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 National Solidarity Party's Choong Hon Heng says Singaporeans should stop "killing themselves", and that the last 10 years have been a struggle. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 The Reform Party rally has started but teen blogger Amos Yee is still the focus of some in the audience. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Workers' Party candidate Daniel Goh on their plans for "A dynamic population for a sustainable Singapore." Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Singapore Democratic Party's Jufri Salim talks about educational reforms and about the high medical costs his brother incurred. He says his family wouldn't have suffered financially if the SDP healthcare policy was in place. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Benjamin Pwee, who quit Democratic Progressive Party for a joint SPP-DPP team contesting Bishan-Toa Payoh GRC, and DPP's Chia Ser Lin, on stage at Toa Payoh Stadium. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.
#GE2015 Reform Party chairman Andy Zhu's speech at a rally was disrupted - by his phone. Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.
#GE2015 A Reform Party member takes the stage, says party is not looking for "elites". Follow our live blog (str.sg/Z7Pd) and Twitter (twitter.com/STcom) for the latest news.

#GE2015 Here's a snippet from Independent candidate Han Hui Hui's rally speech. She says Singapore's healthcare system is not "value for money", calls the Pioneer Generation package "as good as a scam". Follow our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) or check out our live blog. (str.sg/Z7Pd)

#GE2015 "What a tremendous change 50 years has brought us. Today the Sing dollar is worth three Ringgit," says Deputy Prime Minister Teo Chee Hean. Follow our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom) or check out our live blog. (str.sg/Z7Pd)

Follow our live blog here (str.sg/Z7Pd) and our Twitter (www.twitter.com/STcom)

Singapore leaders have expressed their shock and sadness after Taleban gunmen went on the rampage and killed more than 140 people, mostly schoolchildren, in Pakistan. goo.gl/XrXHpt

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, in a letter to his Pakistani counterpart, Nawaz Sharif, on Wednesday, said the incident "is a painful reminder of why we are fighting against the terrorist cause, and why we must remain vigilant and resolute in this long battle".  Deputy Prime Minister and Home Affairs Minister Teo Chee Hean and Foreign Affairs and Law Minister K Shanmugam commented on the incident in Facebook postings.

Northern Japan is in the grip of a blizzard as strong winds and heavy snow on Wednesday led to the cancellation of almost 300 flights and buried vehicles in deep drifts. The bad weather is expected to last until Thursday. goo.gl/35lCvc

Changi Airport Group said that no flights between Japan and Singapore were affected.

The police on Friday issued an appeal for information on a man they hope can assist them with investigations into a case of outrage of modesty. The alleged incident took place along Woodlands Street 32 on Nov 1, and the man in question is believed to be of medium build with short black hair, as pictured. He is about 1.7m tall, and was seen wearing a black round neck T-shirt.
Anyone with information is requested to call the Police Hotline on 1800-255-0000. Information can also be submitted online at www.police.gov.sg/CrimeStopper. Police said that all information will be kept strictly confidential.

Hundreds of millions of euros have been found "tucked away" in accounts of various Vatican departments without having appeared in the city-state's balance sheets, according to Australian Cardinal George Pell who is now overseeing the Holy See's finances. goo.gl/SWwX5z

Cardinal Pell did not suggest any wrongdoing but said Vatican departments had long had "an almost free hand" with their finances and followed "long-established patterns" in managing their affairs.

SEX PREDATOR 1 -  A district judge on Thursday warned parents about letting their children surf the Internet unsupervised when he sentenced an unemployed man to three years' jail for sexually abusing and threatening a teenager whom he knew would be 15 this year. Chock Soon Seng, 37, a former school teacher, had been jailed 10 months in 2010 for two counts of attempted exploitation of a child. goo.gl/1tJ7uM

SEX PREDATOR 2 - In a separate case on Thursday, a 24-year-old construction worker, Dong Yongwei, was sentenced to a year in prison after admitting to having unprotected sex with a girl half his age whom he had met online, even doing the deed on her parents' bed. goo.gl/WdXF4C

Skies were still dark but by 6am on Sunday morning, runners were already milling around the start point of the inaugural Straits Times Run in the Park at the Punggol Waterway Park. ST editor Warren Fernandez flagged off the 15km competitive run at 6.45am - the first of three runs. #STRun

Expect to see a blue stream of more than 12,000 runners at the Punggol Waterway on Sunday morning. They are participants in The Straits Times Run in the Park. Not only will the event be ST's first run, it will also be the largest running event at one of Singapore's newest park connectors. Nicknamed the 'Venice of Punggol', the Waterway features a series of distinctive bridges and great reservoir views.

More mothers here are breastfeeding, as a result of hospitals here implementing international recommendations to encourage and help them to do so.

National University Hospital has become the first hospital in Singapore to be accredited under the Baby-Friendly Hospital Initiative by the World Health Organisation and United Nations Children's Fund.

Four other hospitals here have also put in place most of the 10 guidelines under the initiative to promote breastfeeding.

Joyce Teo looks at the obstacles to breastfeeding and how the hospitals are helping mothers overcome them in ST Mind Your Body, which comes with The Straits Times today.

Once-in-a-lifetime shot: AFP's Olivier Morin - who took this photo on Aug 11 during the 2013 IAAF World Championships in Moscow - wrote in the AFP's Correspondent's Blog: "I took this picture with one of five remote-controlled cameras I'd set up by the side of the track to capture the race winner from various angles and perspectives. Of course, I didn't know for sure who'd win, but when I was setting up the gear it seemed like a fair bet to focus on Usain Bolt's lane!

"The remote-controlled camera that took this picture was the fifth of my rig, set pretty far back, about 30 metres, from the finish line. The idea was to make a photo of the winner with his arms raised and with the stadium in the background, as well as capturing a little bit of the sky. I was thinking more along the lines of an enduring feature photograph, rather than your typical news shot. 

"When Bolt did win, he seemed somewhat unemotional as he crossed the finish line, only really reacting a moment later. Still, I of course fired all of my cameras – the one in my hands and the remote-controlled devices that can be operated with a foot switch. 

"My hand-held shots are transmitted directly to AFP's photo editors, while those from the remote-controlled device go straight to my laptop. I started looking through these images one at a time – there were a few decent shots on the first four cameras. Then I opened up the pictures from the final camera."

He went on to explain more of his craft in his blog. But Morin capped off saying: "This was, I think, a once-in-a-lifetime moment. In my 25 years as a photographer I've never had an uncontrollable external element make a photo like this, and I imagine if I tried again for a similar result for the next 50 years, it wouldn't happen again. So, I only really give myself credit for one percent of this picture!"

-- PHOTO: AFP

Read Morin's full blog at AFP's Correspondents Blog: http://bit.ly/13UtRwT

INFOGRAPHIC: Residents in west Singapore scurried for cover after a rare hailstorm wreaked havoc, uprooting trees and disrupting traffic. But it is unlikely that the hail was triggered by cloud seeding in Indonesia, experts said.

 "Hail is produced by sizeable cumulonimbus clouds located in very high altitude where temperature is very low," said atmosphere scientist Erwin Mulyana of Indonesia's Agency for the Assessment and Application of Technology. "Above Riau, the cumulonimbus clouds are thin and small, and are not at a high altitude."

For more updates: http://www.straitstimes.com/the_haze_in_singapore
Smoke over Singapore and part of Sumatra, collected June 24. -- PHOTO: NASA

Visitors to the Singapore Zoo get up close to take photos of Inuka the polar bear in its new enclosure on May 29, 2013. The first polar bear born in the tropics, the Singapore Zoo's Inuka, moved into his new home at the zoo on Wednesday. The $8million exhibit, which at 2,700sq m is four times bigger than the previous one, was modelled after the bear's natural environment in the arctic. Called the Frozen Tundra, it features a large pool with a waterfall and an ice cave where Inuka can rest in. (Photo: Raj Nadarajan/ The Straits Times)

What goes into the price of a car? The Straits Times breaks down the factors that make up your car's list price.

Cars and car prices are the current hot topic on our live blog. Follow the discussion at www.straitstimes.com.

We've kicked off our live blog with a panel of experts on car questions over at www.straitstimes.com.

Replying to a question from reader Lai Yew Loon, who asked what options there are for people who really need a car but are unable to pay the 40% down payment, ST Senior Correspondent Christopher Tan suggested: 

"They can consider leasing a car, joining a car-sharing club, car-pool, or take taxis. 

"The latter best replicates the benefits of car ownership although the monthly instalments are higher. For instance, a Mazda3 in today's COE prices will cost $2,000 or so a month versus $1,300 if you bought it through hire purchase. "

Follow more of the discussion on our website.

What is the outlook for the COE in the next six months? Should I buy now, or wait and see? 

If you have a question about recent policy changes to the car market, get expert advice on Monday, March 4, between 12.30pm and 1.30pm.

It's your last chance to get your questions answered by our panel of experts, so please leave your questions in the comments below. Thanks!

Arsenal have had no contact over a potential takeover, sources said, amid reports of a looming record bid by a Gulf consortium.

Reports in British newspapers suggested that an investment group backed by funds from Qatar and the United Arab Emirates were preparing a £1.5 billion (S$2.8 billion) bid for the English Premier League club. However, sources close to the Gunners' board told Britain's PA domestic news agency that there had been no approach - informal or otherwise.

Read more: http://bit.ly/12n66i1

Photo: AP

Scientists say a baby born with the Aids virus appears to have been cured thanks to faster and stronger treatment than is usual for newborns.

Scientists say the Mississippi child is now 2 years old and has been off HIV drugs for about a year with no signs of infection. If he remains healthy, it would mark only the world's second reported cure. 

Read more: http://bit.ly/YIkc51

Earlier today, the creator of the Google Chrome extension "Go Away MDA" alleged on his website getgom.com that he had not spoken to ST reporter Lim Yan Liang for the article "Web add-on bypasses porn censors' filters" published on Feb 28, and that the quotes attributable to him were fabricated.

This is untrue. ST's Mr Lim was in contact with the creator via private message and SMS from Feb 25 to Feb 27, before the article's publication. The quotes attributed to the creator are from these correspondences, as well as a nine-minute phone conversation at 9.48pm on Feb 27. At no time did the creator indicate that his comments were not to be used. He was also fully aware of ST's intention to publish the story. 

The screenshots (below), as well as other SMS and private message logs, support this.

Yap Koon Hong
ST Readers' Editor

Tagged: publichouse.sg The Real Singapore

His hands are tied to the rear of a police van while his body lies behind it, on the ground. The van speeds off, dragging the slender man along the pavement as a crowd of onlookers shouts in dismay and at least one videotapes the scene. He is later found dead in a police cell.

It's a gut-wrenching video, made all the more disturbing by the fact that the men who carried out the abuse were uniformed South African police officers and the van was a marked police vehicle.

The Asia News Network (ANN) launched a logo contest with the theme "Emerging Asia" to reflect the region's expanding role on the global stage.

The logo contest will award the major winner US$3,000 (S$3,700). Submission of entries is from March 1-31, 2013.

The first round of the contest will involve an online voting where 20 finalists will be chosen for the final round. Editors and select art directors from ANN will comprise the judges for the final round, to be held at the annual board meeting in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, in late April. The winner will be announced on April 30, 2013.

For more details on the contest, visit www.asianewsnet.net/logocontest.

Mr James Comisar is the first to acknowledge that more than a few have questioned his sanity for spending the better part of 25 years collecting everything from the costume actor George Reeves wore in the 1950s TV show Superman to the entire set of The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson chat show.

Then there's the pointy Spock ears Leonard Nimoy wore on Star Trek and the guns Tony Soprano used to rub out a mob rival in an episode of The Sopranos. "Along the way people thought I was nuts in general for wanting to conserve Keith Partridge's flared pants from The Partridge Family," the good-natured former TV writer says of the 1970s sitcom as he ambles through rows of costumes, props and what have you from the beginnings of television to the present day.

The four-time Asean champions lift their AFF Suzuki Cup in front of fans at the Jalan Besar Stadium.

The three-banded armadillo, a threatened species chosen as the official mascot for the 2014 World Cup, could disappear entirely within decades, a Brazilian NGO has warned.

Known as the "tatu-bola" in its native Brazil, the animal "is at risk and, if nothing is done immediately in terms of conservation, the species could be extinct within 50 years," Mr Rodrigo Castro, executive head of the Caatinga NGO, was quoted as saying.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/RLNMu3

Photo: AFP

Thai football player Kirati Keawsombut (left) battles for the ball with Mohamad Shaiful Esah Nain (right) during their AFF Suzuki football Cup final second leg in Bangkok on Dec 22, 2012. 

Singapore lifted the Asean Football Federation Suzuki Cup for a record fourth time on Saturday, despite going down 0-1 to Thailand in the second leg in Bangkok. -- PHOTO: AFP 

Full story http://bit.ly/UXEaZM

Congratulations to the 10 winners of The Hobbit Reader Review contest. Your entries definitely garnered the attention of John Lui, Film Correspondent at ST Life! http://bit.ly/TeSNZi 

We extend a huge thank to all our readers who participated in the contest. 

To the rest of our readers, please do continue submitting your movies/music/tv/show reviews to ST Communities http://bit.ly/TeSNZi

-- PHOTO: WARNER BROS

Christmas light-up 2011.  -- ST PHOTO: NURIA LING

Vote for your favourite Christmas light-up from previous years here: http://on.fb.me/UXjT6F

Two species of far-north seals, victims of disappearing sea ice and dwindling snowpack in their Arctic habitat, will be granted protections under the Endangered Species Act, federal officials announced on Friday.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/Vbu6P6

-- PHOTO: AP

"The only thing that stops a bad guy with a gun is a good guy with a gun," said National Rifle Association (NRA) chief executive Wayne LaPierre.

NRA went on the offensive on Friday, arguing that schools should have armed guards, on a day that Americans remembered the victims of the Connecticut school massacre with a moment of silence.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/VV8pPK

-- PHOTO: AP

Orchard Road Christmas light-up draws flak yet again. Christmas festivities are in full swing, but shoppers on Orchard Road are not quite cheering the festive decorations there. -- PHOTO: BUSINESS ASSOCIATION 

Full story: http://bit.ly/TFHMA9. Vote for your favourite Christmas light-up from previous years here: http://on.fb.me/Vach2X

In our story yesterday (Dec 20), it was reported that Singapore was ranked 114 out of 146 countries for volunteering time for charitable causes, in the latest World Giving index.   We ranked 53 for donating money.  The report used data from international polling company Gallup, which polled more than 155,000 people in 146 countries last year. Do you agree with these two rankings? Why or why not? Take part in our Facebook poll below. If you have your own reasons, simply comment below.

As pockets of anxiety crop up ahead of the day billed as the Maya apocalypse, a motley crew of New Age thrill-seekers, mystics and tourists have gathered at ancient holy sites in Mexico hoping to witness the birth of a new era.

For more pictures, go to: http://bit.ly/TaLP8M

-- PHOTO: REUTERS

People dress up in costumes and take in the festive sights at Usaquen Park during the annual Festival de Navidad (Festival of Christmas) celebrations in Bogota, Colombia, Dec 19, 2012.

For more pictures, go to: http://bit.ly/R6XjKJ

--PHOTO: REUTERS
Christmas is the time of year when Orchard Road is lit up with fancy decorations. Which do you like best? Comment below.

In the bar overlooking the twisting vines in India's answer to Napa Valley, a group of friends from Mumbai enjoy a weekend getaway - and a chance to brush up on their new wine-drinking hobby.

"I've been teetotal all my life, but quite recently I started to drink wine. It's a growing trend," said 30-year-old housewife Jol Kapadia, sipping on a glass of Chenin Blanc at Sula Vineyards. 

For the full story and more pictures, go to: http://bit.ly/T9fpeW

--PHOTO: AFP

Singapore beat Thailand 3-1 in Wednesday's first-leg of the Asean Football Federation Suzuki Cup final at the Jalan Besar Stadium.

For the full story, go to http://bit.ly/UDqZwB

--ST PHOTO: LIM SIN THAI
Photos from the AFF Suzuki Cup final at Jalan Besar Stadium

An 11-year-old boy caught with a gun at school told administrators he brought the weapon to defend himself in case of an attack similar to the mass school shooting last week in Connecticut, school officials said on Tuesday.

The boy was being held in juvenile detention on suspicion of possessing a dangerous weapon and aggravated assault after other students at the suburban Salt Lake City elementary school told police he threatened them with the handgun.

Read story here: http://bit.ly/R4cXqc

-- PHOTO: AFP

The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey is ST reader Nicholas Tang's movie of the year. Read his review here: http://bit.ly/V4QE46

Want to win movie premiums from The Hobbit? Write a review of The Hobbit on ST Communities to stand a chance.

Contest ends today (Dec 19) at noon. Details here: http://bit.ly/SNQZpM

status_message:
From a devilish-looking bat to a frog that sings like a bird, scientists have identified 129 new species in the Greater Mekong area, the WWF said on Tuesday in a new report detailing discoveries in 2011.

But from forest loss to the construction of major hydropower projects on the Mekong River, existing threats to the region's biodiversity mean many of the new species are already struggling to survive, the conservation group warned.

For the full story and more pictures: http://bit.ly/WlgvU6

--PHOTO:  AFP

"We can't tolerate this anymore. These tragedies must end. And to end them we must change," said US President Barack Obama at a memorial service for the victims of a mass shooting at a Connecticut elementary school.

"In the coming weeks I'll use whatever power this office holds to engage my fellow citizens from law enforcement to mental health professionals to parents and educators in an effort aimed at preventing more tragedies like this," he said.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/U3pUjN

-- PHOTO: REUTERS

"I was going back to my classroom and I heard like a person kicking on the door and I turned around I smelled smoke," an eight-year-old boy told NBC.

"Then bullets whizzed by and then a teacher pulled me into her room."

More of the Connecticut School Shooting in The Big Story http://bit.ly/TZId9z

-- PHOTO: REUTERS

Miss Guatemala Laura Godoy performs onstage at the 2012 Miss Universe National Costume Show at PH Live in Las Vegas, Nevada on Dec 14, 2012. -- PHOTO: REUTERS

More photos http://bit.ly/VHTMPz

"This is a kind of community, when things like that happen, they really pull together," Monsignor Robert Weiss said as he closed the special service he convened after hearing news of the slaughter. -- PHOTO: AP

More of the Connecticut School Shooting in The Big Story http://bit.ly/TZId9z

World leaders expressed shock and horror after a gunman massacred 20 small children and six teachers on Friday in the US state of Connecticut, in one of the worst school shootings in history. -- PHOTO: AFP 

UN chief Ban Ki Moon gave his "deepest condolences at the shocking murders," a statement said. "The targeting of children is heinous and unthinkable," he added in condemning the "horrendous" crime.

European Union diplomacy chief Catherine Ashton expressed "shock" at the "tragic shooting."

Pope Benedict XVI wrote in his letter of condolence to the community, which was read aloud at a vigil in Newtown Friday evening: "I ask God our father to console all those who mourn and to sustain the entire community with the spiritual strength which triumphs over violence by the power of forgiveness, hope and reconciling love."

Full story http://bit.ly/UuH4Ek. More reports in The Big Story http://bit.ly/TZId9z

A new pets' obituary section in the classifieds will allow pet owners to pay tribute to their recently departed pets. 

Tributes up to 30 words are free, subject to space, while a tribute including a picture and up to 60 words will cost $50. -- PHOTO: COURTESY OF CATS CLASSIFIED 

Full story http://bit.ly/VHwedO

In a small Arctic town in Sweden, a construction crew bundled up in heavy parkas is bustling around a building site unlike any other: a massive ice hotel is taking shape.

View more pictures of the ice hotel here: http://bit.ly/Zt2wQF

-- PHOTO: AFP

Choking up and wiping away tears, President Barack Obama said on Friday "our hearts are broken" for the victims of a deadly shooting rampage at a Connecticut elementary school and called for "meaningful action" to prevent such violence.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/W7gCqb

-- PHOTO: REUTERS

The families of victims grieve near Sandy Hook Elementary School, where a gunman opened fire on school children and staff, killing 20 kids and 6 adults. 

The gunman was armed with sophisticated handguns, according to police in Connecticut. 

Read more here: http://bit.ly/TZKXUr

-- PHOTO: AFP

Liverpool beat a Singapore Youth Selection 1-0 in their semi-final clash and will go on to face Sporting Lisbon in the NexLions Cup youth tournament final.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/TSd2ug

-- ST PHOTO: LIM SIN THAI

Aleksandar Duric's daughter Isabella, 10, fired questions at her father after the Lions' 1-0 win over the Philippines at the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals.

Watch the VIDEO here: http://bit.ly/VFJiQM

-- VIDEO: S-League TV

Australian actor Hugh Jackman got a Hollywood double whammy on Thursday as he was nominated for a Golden Globe and got his star on Tinseltown's famous Walk of Fame on the same day.

View more pictures here: http://bit.ly/ZnAbLu

-- PHOTO: AFP

They can seem like nameless, anonymous faces in a crowd.

But each of the more than 100,000 Bangladeshi workers here has a story to tell.

Eager to find out more, three young Singaporeans packed their bags and headed for Bangladesh.

The result is a poignant documentary and photo exhibition that offer people in the Republic a glimpse into the lives of these men who toil in their midst.

The group, which included Joses Kuan, Bernice Wong and Ng Yiqin, spent a fortnight living with the families of five Bangladeshi construction workers in July.

This picture shows Ms Bernice Wong (third from left) and her friends, who have been organising concerts with Bangladeshi workers playing in a band alongside Singaporeans. Ms Ng Yiqin is on the extreme left

To find out more about their project, as well as charitable causes in our Causes Week Big Story: http://bit.ly/VDZxOz

-- PHOTOS: BEYOND THE BORDER, BEHIND THE MEN

Singapore players celebrate with goal scorer Khairul Amri (right) during the second leg semi-final match of the AFF Suzuki Cup 2012 held at Jalan Besar Stadium on Dec 12, 2012. 

Fellow three-time winners Thailand will be Singapore's opponents in the final of the Asean Football Federation Suzuki Cup. -- TNP PHOTO: GARY GOH 

Full story http://bit.ly/TcIwfS

Ocularist Gerhard Greiner compares two different former glass eyes of patient Helmut Sechser in his medical equipment shop in Munich.

For a series of photos about how a glass eye is made and fitted, go to http://bit.ly/VE5wTt

-- PHOTO: REUTERS

Ending the 12.12.12 Hurricane Sandy benefit concert with a bang, Paul McCartney joined Krist Novoselic and Dave Grohl for a Nirvana reunion. 

Watch the VIDEO here: http://bit.ly/QWnHqx

-- PHOTO: AFP

The long-awaited Google Maps app for Apple's iOS 6 is finally here. The Straits Times Digital Life had an exclusive first look at the free navigation app yesterday, before the official launch this afternoon.

Find out more about the app here: http://bit.ly/W7DC4p

-- PHOTO: GOOGLE

After reading online about a teacher who mocked a special needs student for salivating, Mr Ryan Ng was infuriated.

The 21-year-old, who has a mentally-challenged brother, decided to do something to combat "condescending" attitudes.

In March, Mr Ryan Ng, a keen dragon boater, roped in three other trainers to help set up Deaf Dragons - a team of about five hearing members and 17 individuals with hearing impairment, mostly from the Singapore Association for the Deaf.

Despite taking up the paddling sport in March with little water confidence, by July, the outfit finished first in the disabled category of the eighth Club Crew World Championships in Hong Kong.

Read more about their story, as well as other charitable causes in our Causes Week Big Story: http://bit.ly/Sf4ceo

-- ST PHOTO: DESMOND WEE

Bruce Springsteen (left) and Jon Bon Jovi performing at the 12-12-12 The Concert for Sandy Relief at Madison Square Garden in New York on Wednesday, Dec 12, 2012.

The impressive line-up features The Rolling Stones, Bruce Springsteen, Paul McCartney, The Who, Bon Jovi, Eric Clapton, Dave Grohl of the Foo Fighters, Billy Joel, Alicia Keys, Chris Martin, Pink Floyd bassist Roger Waters, Sean Combs and Kanye West.

Watch the live concert here on ST Communities: http://bit.ly/Rq6rvu

-- PHOTO: AP

Student Ben Lim, dressed as Gollum at the special sneak peek at The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey at the the Shaw Lido cinema tonight as part of Straits Times Appreciates Readers (Star) programme. -- ST PHOTO: MARK CHEONG 

On Wednesday evening, fans dressed up as characters from The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey joined more than 3,000 people at special sneak preview of the blockbuster movie ahead of the official opening of the movie on Thursday.  Full story http://bit.ly/XSVe8e

Send in your reviews of The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey and win movie premiums, including buttons and character posters. Details: http://bit.ly/SNQZpM

Singapore have reached the final of the Asean Football Federation Suzuki Cup following their 1-0 over the Philippines at the Jalan Besar Stadium on Wednesday evening.

For the full story, go to http://bit.ly/UByB3g

-- PHOTO: MUGILAN RAJASEGERAN

The People's Association has confirmed that Ms Laura Ong, a constituency director of Pasir Ris West Constituency Office, has quit.

Ms Ong is understood to be the woman whom former Speaker of the House Michael Palmer had an extra-marital affair with.

For the full story: http://bit.ly/TUujFG

--ST PHOTO: MUGILAN RAJASEGERAN

Dress up and win a tablet at Star Movie Night: On Dec 12, The Straits Times will be holding a special screening of the blockbuster movie The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey for its readers with tickets. More information http://bit.ly/YtJFWf

Speaker of Parliament Michael Palmer has resigned as an MP today after revealing that he that he had been involved in an extramarital affair.  

For more, go to http://bit.ly/T7659L

The Spice Girls braved sub-zero conditions to greet fans on the red carpet at the opening night of stage musical Viva Forever in London on Tuesday.

For more pictures of the premiere, go to http://bit.ly/YY7Xbm

PHOTO: AP

Loved The Hobbit? Hated it?

Whatever your views, write a review of the movie after you have seen it this week and you could win movie premiums, including buttons and character posters. 

Simply visit ST Communities and click on the Text icon in the blue contributions bar and say "Hobbit review:", plus your title in the headline. Sign in with your Facebook or Twitter account and post it.

For more details: http://bit.ly/SNQZpM

--PHOTO: WARNER BROS

Peter Jackson, director of The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey, can go on at length about why he had only one actor in mind for the part of Bilbo Baggins, the short, hairy-footed creature at the centre of the movie that opens this week, and in the two sequels.

"Martin Freeman - we always had him in mind for Bilbo. We never wanted anyone else. The part needed a dramatic actor who could do comedy and that is a hard thing to find," says Jackson, 51, who also directed, co-wrote and co-produced the Lord Of The Rings trilogy.

For the full story and more pictures, visit ST Communities at: http://bit.ly/SSJyPk

--PHOTO: WARNER BROS

This Christmas season, around 10 to 12 girls from various girls' homes here will be baking hundreds of sticky date fruitcakes to sell.

As part of a social enterprise project now in its second year, they will be learning many aspects of managing an F&B business such as baking skills and how to manage deliveries and costs.

The project is a culmination of a year-long mentoring programme that teaches older girls job-related skills. This year, Beautiful People aims to bake about 500 cakes and has received around 300 orders so far, said entrepreneur Shindy Vij, 53.

Read more about the project, as well as other charitable causes here: http://bit.ly/UyCJB5

-- ST PHOTO: LAU FOOK KONG

A pair of highly trained canines guided a modified car along a New Zealand race track Monday, passing their doggie driving tests with flying collars on live television, despite the odd off-road detour.

For more pictures, go to http://bit.ly/SQQU5S

-- PHOTO: AFP PHOTO/MICHAEL BRADLEY/DRAFTFCB NZ

From runners dressed as Father Christmas in Germany to same-sex couples take their vows in Seattle, here's a selection of the best photos from Reuters news agency gathered over the last 24 hours.
 
For more pictures, go to: http://bit.ly/TWNLzh

--PHOTO: REUTERS

Runners dressed as Father Christmas take part in the so-called 'Nikolaus Run' in the East German town of Michendorf some 40km south-west of Berlin on Dec 9, 2012. Around 800 participants took part in the Santa Claus running competition that is hosted by the Laufclub Michendorf running association. 

For more photos from Reuters news agency gathered over the last 24 hours, go to: http://bit.ly/TWNLzg

-- PHOTO : REUTERS

Financial consultant Sean Ong will be spending his Christmas season a little differently this year: He's donning his running shoes with the aim of running 1,000km in 100 days to raise funds for Club Rainbow, a charity that supports chronically ill children.

Mr Ong's fundraising drive is one of the causes we're highlighting in our first Causes Week, where we feature stories about charities and causes, as well as the people and organisations raising funds for them. 

Read more about his run for charity, as well as other charitable causes here: http://www.straitstimes.com/causes_week

Photo: Mark Cheong for The Straits Times

In a busy passage in Amsterdam's red light district a crowd is gathering as fans jostle to have their picture taken with the city's most famous great-grannies: Louise and Martine Fokkens, the Dutch capital's oldest twin prostitutes.

Decked out in matching red leather jackets and boots, red jeans and crocheted red berets, with Stars and Stripes scarves draped around their necks, the Fokkens cut a jaunty pair as they saunter down alleys with red-framed windows where semi-nude 'working women' put their bodies on display to lure customers.

For more pictures, go to: http://bit.ly/VGY9R4

--PHOTO: AFP

Japanese model-singer Tsubasa Masuwaka, the creator of the popular Japanese eyelash and eye make-up brand Dolly Wink, wants to continue wearing the doll-like look even if she is in her 40s or 50s.

She was in town for the first time over the weekend to crown the winner of the inaugural Shibuya Gals X Dolly Wink Lookalike Contest at Scape on Saturday.

For more pictures of the contestants, go to http://bit.ly/XEdiTs

PHOTO: DIOS VINCOY JR FOR THE STRAITS TIMES

Alicia Keys raised $3.54m at Keep A Child Alive gala, a charity that assists those affected by the human immunodeficiency virus infection/acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (HIV/AIDS) in Africa and India. 

Keys also honoured Oprah Winfrey at the event for the entrepreneur's philanthropic efforts, including her school, The Oprah Winfrey Leadership Academy for Girls in South Africa, which launched in 2007.

Read story and see more pictures here: http://bit.ly/U17XPP

-- PHOTO: AP

This year's ChildAid concert raised a record sum of more than $2 million, higher than last year's $1.88 million.

The annual charity concert, in its eighth year, is organised by The Straits Times and The Business Times.

For more pictures, go to: http://bit.ly/U0Naft

-- ST PHOTOS: LAU FOOK KONG

Quake shakes Japan, no reports of deaths or serious damage. The quake had a preliminary magnitude of 7.3, thousands of coastal residents were ordered to evacuate to higher ground, but the tsunami warning was lifted 2hrs after the tremor struck.

Watch VIDEO here: http://bit.ly/VnQuBj

 -- PHOTO: REUTERS

Today in Pictures | December 7, 2012: http://bit.ly/WNuwZu
Participants parade through the streets in swimwear to raise money for aborigines in Australia, severe weather in Argentina, and a dog named Monty takes the driver's seat in New Zealand. This, and more pictures, from around the world via Through the Lens.

Condo resale prices may reach historic high in fourth quarter. The average condo resale price rose to $1,222 psf for October and November, the Singapore Real Estate Exchange said yesterday.

Read more here: bit.ly/WNpmga

Rather than chasing cars, dogs in New Zealand are being taught to drive them - steering, pedals and all - in a heartwarming project aimed at increasing pet adoptions from animal shelters.

More pictures here: http://bit.ly/SRFLjN

-- PHOTO: AFP/DRAFTFCB

President Barack Obama on Thursday empathised with Superstorm Sandy victims as he dispensed seasonal cheer at the lighting of the US National Christmas tree in Washington.

For more pictures of the Christmas tree lighting, go to: http://bit.ly/YHz8qK

-- PHOTO: AFP

Resorts World Sentosa celebrates its grand opening today with a forecast of 17 million visitors next year - the first year it will run at full operations.

The last major attraction, the Marine Life Park, was launched two weeks ago.

Read more: http://bit.ly/VAFXIN

-- ST PHOTO: NURIA LING

This undated image made available by Nasa and photographed by the Expedition 28 crew aboard the International Space Station, shows the moon, at centre with the limb of Earth near the bottom transitioning into the orange-colored troposphere, the lowest and most dense portion of the Earth's atmosphere. 

A team of former Nasa executives are launching a private venture to send people to the moon for $1.83 billion. The newly formed business is offering countries a two-person trip to the moon, either for research or national prestige.

Read more: http://bit.ly/YH2GVv

-- PHOTO: AP

Walt Disney World marked the grand opening on Thursday of a new Fantasyland at its Magic Kingdom park in Orlando, Florida, where patrons won't have to wait very long to see exhibits and alcoholic beverages will be offered for the first time.

Disney World said the opening capped the largest expansion in the park's 41-year history, doubling the size of Fantasyland and offering two new rides.

For more pictures, go to: http://bit.ly/VAlMe4

-- PHOTO: AP

Villagers wash their clothes amidst a destroyed banana plantation after Typhoon Bopha hit Compostela Valley, southern Philippines on Dec 5, 2012. 

Blocked roads and severed communications in the southern Philippines frustrated rescuers on Wednesday as teams searched for hundreds of people missing after the strongest typhoon this year killed at least 283 people. 

For more photos gathered over the last 24 hours, go to: http://bit.ly/VodArg

-- PHOTO : REUTERS

The four SMRT drivers from China charged with instigating last week's strike, have been granted bail.

Clockwise from top left: SMRT bus drivers from China: He Jun Ling, Liu Xiang Ying, Gao Yue Qiang and Wang Xianjie. Gao, Liu and Wang, have been granted bail of $10,000, while He, who faces a second charge of inciting the strike needs to raise $20,000.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/SOyEc2

-- PHOTOS: ZAOBAO, CAROLINE CHIA

At least 325 people were killed and hundreds remain missing in the Philippines following the deadliest typhoon to hit the country this year, the civil defence chief said on Dec 6.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/TGcR8x

-- PHOTO: AFP

On why the activists from Hong Kong are exercised about the situation in Singapore, the group's leader Lee Cheuk Yan told The Straits Times: "If the Singapore government is able to get away with this violation, it will set a bad example to other governments."

For more photos, go to http://bit.ly/Vjv4W5

-- PHOTO: AFP

A worker checks mushroom beds at a private farm, workshops of which are located inside hangars of a former Soviet missile military base, in the village of Minoity, some 160km west of Minsk on Dec 4, 2012. The farm cultivates and sells about 10 tons of oyster mushrooms, or Veshenka mushrooms, each month in Belarus and neighboring countries. The mushrooms cost 23,000 Belarussian roubles (S$3.20) per kg. -- PHOTO: REUTERS

More pictures from around the world in 24 hours: http://bit.ly/VjyxUk

Read ST reader jigglyjoanne's review of The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 2: http://bit.ly/TOtawl

To win exclusive Breaking Dawn Part 2 prizes, contribute a review of that movie on ST's interactive Entertainment Community.

Click here for contest details: http://bit.ly/R3NDlp

A muddy field did not deter fans of American pop star J.Lo from having a good time at Gardens By The Bay last night where she held her first concert in Singapore.

The 43-year-old singer, actress and former American Idol judge from New York ran through a series of hits such as Love Don't Cost A Thing, Waiting For Tonight and Jenny From The Block.

See more pictures on ST Communities: http://bit.ly/R5VbUK

At least 43 villagers and soldiers drowned in a southern Philippine town on Tuesday when torrents of water dumped by a powerful typhoon cascaded down a mountain, engulfing emergency shelters and an army truck, officials said.

The deaths raised the toll from one of the strongest storms to hit the country this year to at least 74.

Read story and see more pictures here: http://bit.ly/QFLKtI

-- PHOTO: AFP

Indonesia Correspondents Zubaidah Naseer and Wahyudi Soeriaatmadja made the dangerous journey to Poso in Central Sulawesi to track down Muslim terrorists in their jungle training camp. They got as close as any foreign journalist ever did. 

Read their report: http://bit.ly/TErYi0

Today in Pictures | December 4, 2012: http://bit.ly/TD7VkJ
Site inspection a day after 89 workers were injured during an oil rig accident in Singapore, protest against high-speed trains in France, and Muhammad Ali is crowned "King of Boxers" in Mexico. This, and more pictures, from around the world. This, and more pictures, from around the world via Through the Lens.

Radio personality Boy Thunder covers One Direction's performance at Madison Square Garden, Dec 3, for ST Communities. 

More pictures here: bit.ly/QDUK2E

Manpower Minister Tan Chuan Jin on Tuesday praised the evacuation efforts at the Jurong Shipyard where an industrial accident a day before had sent more than 1,000 workers scurrying out of an oil rig for safety.

Mr Tan said he was encouraged that all the workers on the rig had been evacuated within 20 minutes.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/UltdB0

-- ST PHOTO: KEVIN LIM

Get the nursery ready: Britain's royal family announced on Monday that Prince William and his wife are expecting their first child.

St. James's Palace said that the Duchess of Cambridge – formerly known as Kate Middleton – has a severe form of morning sickness and is currently in a London hospital.

Read story, watch video and see more pictures here: http://bit.ly/11rJbie

-- ST PHOTO: KEVIN LIM

Local artist Tan Swie Hian's oil and acrylic painting, When The Moon Is Orbed, sold for a record 18.975 million yuan (S$3.7 million) at a Beijing auction last night. 

Read more here: http://bit.ly/UaDptM

-- PHOTO: TAN SWIE HIAN

On Sunday, we asked readers to contribute their photos of the Standard Chartered Marathon. And here they are! If you took pictures at the Marathon and don't mind sharing, we'd love to feature them in this album. Send them to us at stonline@sph.com.sg, or tweet to us at @STcom.
link_name: Your Photos from the Standard Chartered Marathon

status_message:
More than 1,000 people in Taiwan formed a human QR code in an event designed to promote the island to the world by cashing in on the rising use of smartphones, which can read the barcodes.

Always an outlet for fun-loving Singaporeans to let loose, colourful characters were seen at today's Standard Chartered Marathon. 

Characters like The Avengers, Wonder Woman and even The Power Rangers were spotted at today's run. As for the more serious aspects of the day's event, this year's Standard Chartered Marathon Singapore was once again a race that belonged to the Kenyans, as they swept the titles in both the men's and women's elite categories.

See more photos from the marathon today: http://bit.ly/SCWGXg

ST Photo: Desmond Foo

Take the hassle out of slaving over a stove this Christmas with a smorgasbord of Yuletide takeaways and festive goodies available at restaurants and hotels.

Taxidermist Ken Mar, 54, works out of a HDB flat and his showroom in Macpherson. He is one of the few here who ply the trade. He is seen here posing with some of them at Bishan Park.

For more interesting pictures, go to http://bit.ly/Sw8Gv7

PHOTO: KUA CHEE SIONG

SMRT bus drivers rounded up by police this morning at the 2 dormitories were taken to a detention centre at Admiralty.

ST PHOTO: LEONARD LIM

A 24m-tall tree was lit up at the 80th Annual Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony in New York on Nov 28, 2012.

For more photos, go to http://bit.ly/V84SO2

-- PHOTO: REUTERS

A group of about 30 people showed up at the Singapore Zoo early Thursday morning to be among the first to see pandas Kai Kai and Jia Jia.

Read more here: http://bit.ly/11g5S80

-- ST PHOTO: NG KAI LING

The Giant Panda Forest, where pandas Kai Kai and Jia Jia will debut in South East Asia's largest panda exhibit, was officially opened on Wednesday by Mr S Iswaran, Minister in the Prime Minister's Office. 

The exhibit opens to the public on Thursday. Visitors can buy zoo admission tickets ($20 for adults, $13 for children) and pay an extra $5 (adult) or $3 (child) to see the pandas. Does anyone have plans to visit the exhibit this weekend?
